user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of free_unmarked:
```c
static void
free_unmarked (struct MHD_PostProcessor *pp)
{
  if ( (NULL != pp->content_name) &&
       (0 == (pp->have & NE_content_name)) )
  {
    free (pp->content_name);
    pp->content_name = NULL;
  }
  if ( (NULL != pp->content_type) &&
       (0 == (pp->have & NE_content_type)) )
  {
    free (pp->content_type);
    pp->content_type = NULL;
  }
  if ( (NULL != pp->content_filename) &&
       (0 == (pp->have & NE_content_filename)) )
  {
    free (pp->content_filename);
    pp->content_filename = NULL;
  }
  if ( (NULL != pp->content_transfer_encoding) &&
       (0 == (pp->have & NE_content_transfer_encoding)) )
  {
    free (pp->content_transfer_encoding);
    pp->content_transfer_encoding = NULL;
  }
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if ( (NULL != pp->content_filename) &&
       (0 == (pp->have & NE_content_filename)) )
  {
    free (pp->content_filename);
    pp->content_filename = NULL;
  }
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 14.3 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation. The controlling expression depends on runtime values (pp->content_filename and pp->have & NE_content_filename) so it is not invariant. A violation would occur if the condition were a compile-time constant (for example if (1) or if ((NULL != SOME_COMPILE_TIME_CONST_PTR) && (0 == (CONST & NE_content_filename))).
